DefaultEvent.Description: Many boats circle the island, all keeping their distance. The one that gets closest is an extended rowboat painted in yellows, whites and reds. Four servant monkeys strain at the oars, while its true passenger sits in comfort behind a gauze curtain. Just for a moment an eye catches yours, but only for a moment. It would not do for a high-souled ape to see something so beneath its notice.
DefaultEvent.Name: The heart of the Empire

ChildBranches.Name: A Scouting Trip: Sovereign Island
ChildBranches.Description: A wooden palace stretches across the whole island, passage to it lit by a field of tiny glim buoys.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ$The trip offers a little time to think on the Penties. Technically, they are monkeys rather than apes, but it is not tactful to remind them of this. To their high-souled faces, the accepted name is 'Pentecost apes'. In private though, 'the b___y monkeys' is about as common. It is, one might say, an ad hominoid insult.
DefaultEvent.Name: Of apes and monkeys

ChildBranches.Name: $Ash Isthmus -> トネリコ地峡$A Scouting Trip: The Ash Isthmus
ChildBranches.Description: Neither man nor ape claims this volcanic remnant between islands. Haunted, they say. Ridiculous.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Empire of Hands -> エンパイア・オブ・ハンズ$The Empire of Hands is hardly as old as they pretend, but mimicry and theft infuses their whole culture. If the Penties have come to think that rulers should be buried in ancient temples, then it is ancient temples they will build. It would hardly be the first time their attempts to mirror humanity have entirely missed the point.
DefaultEvent.Name: A young ancient empire

ChildBranches.Name: A Scouting Trip: Fountainhead Island
ChildBranches.Description: Ancient secrets peek out of the trees. Any may visit, but few Penties ever bother to make the pilgrimage.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ, Admiralty -> 海軍省$The Admiralty has never stated precisely why it seeks to keep the Empire confined, though most opposition to it fades once said opposers actually encounter a Pentecost ape. They have been easy to corral, however. Though they do not lack wit, there is not an inventive bone in their hairy bodies, and no amount of stolen humanity has taught them the art of creating engines.
DefaultEvent.Name: The Blumenbach Quarantine

ChildBranches.Name: A Scouting Trip: Hearthsake Island
ChildBranches.Description: A thin pillar of greasy yet appetising smoke rises from the only human settlement in the Empire.

DefaultEvent.Description: It has been a long while since you spent this much time behind oars. Your muscles will be glowing by the time you finish your business in the Empire.
DefaultEvent.Name: A quiet, yet exhausting, affair

RareDefaultEvent.Description: You barely row out of the way in time, for it has no intention of turning or slowing. The chattering of angry monkeys fades into the darkness as they head for the other islands in search of food.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: A hunting party powers through the water

ChildBranches.Name: Travel to Sovereign Island
ChildBranches.Description: They still demand a gift worthy of the Emperor to open up their court. Perhaps on another island...

DefaultEvent.Description: "...and left him treading water, all for the sake of the night he'd shared, with the rubb'ry cap'n's daughter..."
DefaultEvent.Name: An old zee-zhanty finds your tongue as you row

RareDefaultEvent.Description: The sound of the oars would almost be hypnotic if your arms weren't burning so hard twith the effort.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: Splash. Splash. Splash. Splash.

ChildBranches.Name: Travel to Fountainhead Island
ChildBranches.Description: Ancient tombs and buried treasure await on this island.

DefaultEvent.Description: The delicious smell of the cannibals' cooking stretches much of the way across the passing. It would make a vegetarian salivate and reach for a fork.
DefaultEvent.Name: A journey into temptation

RareDefaultEvent.Description: It is strange, after so long in a real ship, to be so close to the surface of the zee that you could run your hand through it. Not that this would be a good idea.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: A cold expanse of water

ChildBranches.Name: Travel to Hearthsake Village
ChildBranches.Description: The cannibals always have a seat at their table, and the Lost Treasure Hunter has much to trade.

DefaultEvent.Description: The silence is peaceful here. No engine rumbling, no sounds of crew at work. Just your own heavy breathing as you row, and the rhythmic splash of waters.
DefaultEvent.Name: A softly spreading wake stretches out behind

RareDefaultEvent.Description: These rowboats are not well maintained, if maintained at all. Water dribbles in from a small leak throughout, until it feels that there is as much zee within as without.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: Damp, with sore arms

ChildBranches.Name: $Ash Isthmus -> トネリコ地峡$Travel to The Ash Isthmus

DefaultEvent.Description: There is no welcome. They stare at the ground throughout.
DefaultEvent.Name: The guards nod and open the gates for you

ChildBranches.Name: $Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$Travel to the Wildweald Court
ChildBranches.Description: Your invitation stands unless you violate their sacred laws. Unless of course, they find it funny.

DefaultEvent.Description: You are making waves, it seems. The good kind.
DefaultEvent.Name: The guards salute as you approach the gates

ChildBranches.Name: $Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$Travel to the Wildweald Court
ChildBranches.Description: Your invitation stands unless you violate their sacred laws. Unless of course, they find it funny.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ, Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$Pentecost apes from across the Empire are massing outside the Wildweald Court, screaming for answers and comfort those inside cannot give.
DefaultEvent.Name: An angry mob

RareDefaultEvent.Description: $Pentecost -> ペンテコステ, Wildweald Court -> ワイルドウィールド・コート$Pentecost apes from across the Empire are massing outside the Wildweald Court, screaming for answers and comfort those inside cannot give.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: An angry mob

ChildBranches.Name: Travel to Sovereign Island
ChildBranches.Description: $Zeppelin -> ツェッペリン$The Zeppelin is gone. The Court remains.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Aft -> 後部$The oars slip gently through the zee. After so much practice, it is like zailing through the air.
DefaultEvent.Name: Sliding through the darkness

RareDefaultEvent.Description: From a distance, you can almost see the jungles growing. It would take a lifetime to find anything buried here without some kind of map.
RareDefaultEvent.Name: A return to this mysterious island

ChildBranches.Name: Travel to Fountainhead Island
ChildBranches.Description: The Vault has been conquered, but perhaps more mysteries remain.

DefaultEvent.Description: Oh well. Nothing is going happen either way.
DefaultEvent.Name: Strange. This should have been Impossible.

ChildBranches.Name: $Ash Isthmus -> トネリコ地峡$The Ash Isthmus
ChildBranches.Description: There is nothing more to be done here.

DefaultEvent.Description: Oh well. Nothing is going happen either way.
DefaultEvent.Name: Strange. This should have been Impossible.

ChildBranches.Name: Hearthsake Island
ChildBranches.Description: There is nothing more to be done here.

DefaultEvent.Description: Oh well. Nothing is going happen either way.
DefaultEvent.Name: Strange. This should have been Impossible.

ChildBranches.Name: Fountainhead Island
ChildBranches.Description: There is nothing more to be done here.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Empire of Hands -> エンパイア・オブ・ハンズ, Fallen London -> フォールン・ロンドン, Port Report -> 港湾報告書$Until then, business awaits elsewhere. If only the monkeys had proper ships, their islands would have proper docks capable of handling yours. Oh well. [You will need the help of someone in Fallen London to continue exploring the Empire of Hands. Check your Lodgings after submitting your Port Report.]
DefaultEvent.Name: You make a note to return later

ChildBranches.Name: Look for a rowboat
ChildBranches.Description: They all appear to be in use at the moment.

Description: Communal wooden boats offer free passage to all travellers willing to row between islands.
Name: $Empire of Hands -> エンパイア・オブ・ハンズ$Zailing the Empire of Hands
